children.text:
Now, the variables:

First part variables: a, b, sum (integers)

Second part variables: position (integer*8, since it's the sum from first part, which can be up to (like 1e9?), but in Java it's an int, but in the second program, it's treated as a long. So in Fortran, using integer*8 for position and all variables in second part. Third part variables: the result from second part is an integer*8, which is converted to a string s.

Now, in Fortran code structure:

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: a, b, sum
    integer*8 :: position, result2
    character(len=20) :: s
    integer :: counts(0:9) = 0
    logical :: ok
    integer :: i, n, count_non_zero

    ! First part: read a and b, compute sum
    read*, a, b
    sum =0
    do i=1,2
        if (a >= b) then
            sum = sum +a
            a = a -1
        else
            sum = sum +b
            b = b -1
        end if
    end do

    ! Second part: compute result2
    position = sum  ! convert to integer*8
    integer*8 :: nrstSeqStartIndx, startIndex, temp

    nrstSeqStartIndx = 1
    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx *2) < position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx *2
    end do

    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx +1) < = position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx +1
    end do

    startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)
    result2 = (position - startIndex) +1

    ! Third part: process result2 as string
    write(s, '(I0)') result2
    s = adjustl(s)  ! remove leading spaces

    counts = 0
    count_non_zero =0
    ok = .true. do i=1, len_trim(s)
        character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i)
        integer :: num = ichar(c) - ichar('0')
        counts(num) = counts(num) +1
    end do

    ! Check counts
    count_non_zero =0
    do i=0,9
        if (counts(i) >0) then
            count_non_zero = count_non_zero +1
            if (counts(i) /=2) then
                ok = .false. end if
        end if
    end do

    if (count_non_zero ==2 .and. ok) then
        print*, 'Yes'
    else
        print*, 'No'
    end if

contains

    integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)
        integer*8, intent(in) :: index
        getValueAtIndex = 1 + ( (index -1)*index )

program main
    implicit none

    integer :: a, b, sum
    integer*8 :: position, result2, nrstSeqStartIndx, startIndex
    character(len=20) :: s
    integer :: counts(0:9) = 0
    logical :: ok
    integer :: i, n, count_non_zero

    ! Declare variables for second part
    integer*8 :: temp

    ! First part: read a and b, compute sum
    read*, a, b
    sum =0
    do i=1,2
        if (a >= b) then
            sum = sum +a
            a = a -1
        else
            sum = sum +b
            b = b -1
        end if
    end do

    ! Second part: compute result2
    position = sum  ! convert to integer*8
    nrstSeqStartIndx = 1
    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx *2) < position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx *2
    end do

    do while (getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx +1) <= position)
        nrstSeqStartIndx = nrstSeqStartIndx +1
    end do

    startIndex = getValueAtIndex(nrstSeqStartIndx)
    result2 = (position - startIndex) +1

    ! Third part: process result2 as string
    write(s, '(I0)') result2
    s = adjustl(s)  ! remove leading spaces

    counts = 0
    count_non_zero =0
    ok = .true.

    do i=1, len_trim(s)
        character(len=1) :: c = s(i:i)
        integer :: num = ichar(c) - ichar('0')
        counts(num) = counts(num) +1
    end do

    ! Check counts
    count_non_zero =0
    do i=0,9
        if (counts(i) >0) then
            count_non_zero = count_non_zero +1
            if (counts(i) /=2) then
                ok = .false.
            end if
        end if
    end do

    if (count_non_zero ==2 .and. ok) then
        print*, 'Yes'
    else
        print*, 'No'
    end if

contains

    integer*8 function getValueAtIndex(index)
        integer*8, intent(in) :: index
        getValueAtIndex = 1 + ( (index -1)*index ) /2
    end function

end program main
